RemixAutoML 0.6.0
  • Reference

PostGRE_Query

Source: R/SQL_Functions.R
PostGRE_Query.Rd

PostGRE_Query get data from a database table

PostGRE_Query(
  Query = NULL,
  Connection = NULL,
  CloseConnection = FALSE,
  Host = "localhost",
  DBName = "Testing",
  User = "postgres",
  Port = 5432,
  Password = ""
)

Arguments

Query

SQL Statement in quotes
Connection

db connection
CloseConnection

= FALSE
Host

If Connection is NULL then this must be supplied. host
DBName

If Connection is NULL then this must be supplied. dbname
User

If Connection is NULL then this must be supplied. user
Port

If Connection is NULL then this must be supplied. port
Password

If Connection is NULL then this must be supplied. password

See also

Other Database: AutoDataDictionaries(), PostGRE_AppendData(), PostGRE_CreateTable(), PostGRE_RemoveTable(), SQL_ClearTable(), SQL_DropTable(), SQL_Query_Push(), SQL_Query(), SQL_SaveTable(), SQL_Server_DBConnection()

Author

Adrian Antico

Examples

if (FALSE) {
data <- RemixAutoML::PostGRE_Query(
  Query = 'Select * from static_data',
  Host = 'localhost',
  CloseConnection = FALSE,
  DBName = 'Testing',
  User = 'postgres',
  Port = 5432,
  Password = 'Aa...')

# Query = 'Select * from static_data'
# Host = 'localhost'
# DBName = 'Testing'
# CloseConnection = FALSE,
# User = 'postgres'
# Port = 5432
# Password = 'Aa...'
}
